textList.name: TEXT_UNION_TRAFFIC
textList.text: Pinnacle Robotics facilities like the one near this beacon are notorious for wreaking havoc on unprepared ships passing by, as EMPs used to disable their experimental Sentient Weapons often overwhelm the planet's magnetosphere. It might be inconvenient, but the energy readings from this beacon should throw the rebels off your trail for a while.

Your sensors are overwhelmed with traffic at this beacon, as Archive, Inc. ships work to restore ancient ruins recently identified nearby. The fleet will put a stop to all their work shortly, but the traffic should cover your tracks for now.

You're treated to quite a sight as you drop out of FTL - R.S.T. workers are hard at work testing a new version of their terraforming technology on a planet nearby, with dust clouds rising up to the edge of the planet's atmosphere. You change your jump signature to match one of the ships observing from the beacon - that should keep the rebels off your tail a little longer.

Detritus Disposal is apparently up to something exciting out here - an abandoned colony destroyed in the Federation-Mantis war is apparently slated to be recycled whole in a test for their A.C.I.D. tech's newest iteration. The array of ships hovering nearby to watch the destruction should prove a useful cover for your ship's movements from this beacon.

This beacon is heavily trafficked by numerous civilian vessels of varying origins. Your radio is overcome with a spectrum frequencies that make it impossible to eavesdrop on any pertinent conversations, but at least, the Rebels will struggle to track you amongst the sea of vessels.

event.name: UNION_BREACH
event.text: A Union vessel, severely damaged from a huge hull breach, desperately hails you. They explain that they barely managed to escape from a pirate. They need to transfer crew over to a different ship.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Let them aboard but station your Rock as extra security.
(Soldier Crew) Let them aboard but station your Soldier as extra security.
(Hive Elite) Let them aboard but station your Mantis as extra security.
(Boarding Drone) Let them aboard but station your drone as extra security.
(Adv. Sensors) Let them aboard but keep constant scans running on them.

event.text: You explain your mission is too important to be transporting civilians. They're clearly distressed but are powerless to do anything but accept this.
The civilians are extremely grateful for your help. After gathering all of their possessions and coming aboard, they permit you to scrap their old ship.
The civilians are very thankful for your help. Most agree to be dropped off at the nearest station, but one of them finds themselves longing for some change. They offer to join your crew.

As the civilians come aboard, you notice one of them is carrying an unusually large weapon concealed by their robes. It may just be for self-defense, and calling them out as a threat could cause problems.

You point out the weapon, quickly drawing your blaster before they can do the same. The civilians panic, and they try to explain that the one in the robe is their bodyguard. You apologize but your rash actions have done their damage. The civilians reluctantly go into the cargo bay and refuse to speak to any of your crew until you drop them off at a nearby station, where they briefly thank you and leave as fast as possible.

You draw your laser and stare down the robed "civilian". The rest of the civilians and your crew do the same, and now you find yourself in a rather precarious situation. "Well then captain, I have to applaud you for figuring out this was a ruse. Give us some scrap and we'll be on our way. Otherwise, it's lights out for all-" You cut him off with a shot to the head. Chaos ensues and you prepare to defend the ship from the other pirates.
Luckily, nothing seems to come of it. You drop off the civilians at the nearest station, where they thank and pay you.

You've helped all of the civilians into the cargo-bay and begun to head back to the bridge when you hear the unmistakable sound of a teleporter. You run back to catch several of the "civilians" teleporting away with the contents of your storage. The remaining pirates prepare to fight.
The civilians are extremely grateful for your help. After gathering all of their possessions and coming aboard, they permit you to scrap their old ship.
The civilians are very thankful for your help. Most agree to be dropped off at the nearest station, but one of them finds themselves longing for some change. They offer to join your crew.

The civilians begin to move aboard, but your security notices several of the civilians trying to smuggle weapons onboard. They drop their guns immediately and surrender. Seems this was an elaborate pirate trap! Considering they had no problem trying to rob you, you don't feel guilty at all extorting them for their stuff.

event.name: UNION_FREEMANTIS
event.text: You're contacted by a Free Mantis ship, piloted by a rather lost looking captain. "Oh, great greeting. You not yet run away, so I assume you friendly. We come here by mistake, looking for Federation sector to enroll in military. Now, we hunted by Militia. Very unfortunate. Think you could do favor and convince Militia we good?"

choice.text: Agree to track down the Militia ship hunting them.

event.text: "Much appreciate, friend." You follow their directions and find the Militia ship has already arrived in this system. They haven't noticed you.

"Yeah, what do you want?" You explain the Free Mantis ship they're hunting is only trying to pass through the sector peacefully. He rolls his eyes. "A Zoltan reported that there was a Mantis causing trouble in the area. We'll arrest that bug, obviously. What do you expect us to do?"
The Militia ship is bound to cave in if you can do enough damage to their hull. You ready the weapons.

choice.text: (Free Mantis Crew) Talk to the Militiamen.

event.text: Your Free Mantis walks onto the camera, waving with a big goofy grin. The Militiamen however, are not quite so pleased. "You may be fooled by their sickening facade, but we will never forget! What did all those men and women die for in the Fed-Mantis war if we're just letting the Mantis work alongside us now? You are the reason this galaxy, hell, this Multiverse has gone to shit." They end the call immediately and attack!
"Ugh, fine. This will go badly, mark my words. If they cause any more trouble, we'll have no choice but to kill them."

choice.text: Go back to the Free Mantis.

event.text: If you've learned anything on your mission, it's that the best way to deal with problems is through brutal murder. You power up the weapons and prepare to destroy the Militia ship.
"Ah. Very well. Best luck on mission!"

event.name: UNION_FREEMANTIS_WIN
event.text: You've killed the Militia ship. You've saved the Free Mantis for now, and scrap the remains of the Militia ship.

choice.text: Go back to the Free Mantis.

event.text: "You... you kill them? W-why? That unnecessary. We not want dead civilians. We just want safe travels. Still... you save us. I pay you as thanks, but hope you not do this in future."

event.name: UNION_FREEMANTIS_SURRENDER
event.text: The Militia ship is near destruction. The captain looks at you desperately. "What... are you serious? You're going to kill us for some bloody Mantis?"

choice.text: Let the Free Mantis go and we'll spare you.

event.text: "Jeez, you people are insane. But fine, we'll let them through. These Mantis refugees will be the deaths of us all..."

choice.text: Go back to the Free Mantis.

event.name: UNION_FREEMANTIS_REWARD
event.text: "Many thanks! You have done great favor for us. We in debt to you captain. How can repay you?"
The Free Mantis aren't very good at repairs, but they all work together and manage to repair a decent portion of your hull.
The Free Mantis transfer over some fuel.
The Free Mantis gladly hand over a portion of their scrap stores to you.

event.name: UNION_OUTCAST_REFUGEES
event.text:
There is a heated argument going on at this beacon. An outcast ship escorting an unarmed transport is standing off against a Militia ship. Their chatter is on an open channel.
"...and they have nowhere else to go!"
"Not our problem! You think we can just let your people intrude upon our homes, spouting your crazy nonsense?"
"You do not listen! We are apostates! We are open to learning your customs if it will give us somewhere to live."
"Yeah, that's how it starts. And then you start taking offense to our ideas and replacing it with your own. We're not that naive!"

Tuco slams the wall as his voice booms into the comm. "WHAT AM I LOOKING AT HERE?"
"Who... who are you?" The patrol asks.
Their question is answered by the other ship. "The Dread Pirate Tuco! He's come to help us!"
"Oh crap, the Dread Pirate? This is way above my paygrade... Fine! You can stay. Just... Just don't make a mess!" The Militia patrol warps out.

"The Dread Pirate Tuco has saved us! Hail Tuco, our savior!" The outcasts cheer on your ship and lavish you with as much as they can in tribute. Tuco chuckles as he takes a swig. "When you're that good, your reputation alone can do it for you."

choice.text: (Outcast Crew) Recommend that the outcasts continue along.

event.text:
Your crewmember hails the escort and suggests that they continue moving.
"We have come so far, and are always told to keep going."
Your outcast tells them that they will find what they are looking for, but not here. The captain relents, and the ships leave.

choice.text: Recommend that the outcasts continue along.
Accuse the patrol of being prejudiced.

event.text: The Outcast responds to your hostile actions by powering weapons.
You've heard enough. This Militia ship seems unreasonable. They are surprised at your sudden attack and respond in kind.
Their shouting match is none of your business.
You try to convince the refugees to leave. The outcast escort captain sighs. "I can see we are outnumbered. So be it. We will move along."
You try to convince the refugees to leave. The outcast escort glares. "We have come so far, and traveled so long. We aren't moving. You can attack us or you can leave. Do what you will."
The Outcast responds to your hostile actions by powering weapons.
You leave the scene behind. The situation is still unresolved, but seems to be nonviolent for now.

The captain of the Militia patrol sputters. "Me? A bigot? I'm just... Look I'm.... I'm trying to represent the interests of... I'm just... Whatever! Stay, then. Watch as things go badly, and I will still be here to say I told you so!"
The captain of the Militia patrol scoffs. "You Federation types. You don't get it. You think everything is solved by a little hand holding. Get out of here, this doesn't concern you."
You've heard enough. This Militia ship seems unreasonable. They respond in kind.
You leave the scene behind. The situation is still unresolved, but seems to be nonviolent for now.
The captain of the Militia patrol growls at you. "I'm sick of the Federation always acting so high and mighty. Time to knock you down a peg!"

event.name: MILITIA_OUTCAST_REFUGEES_LEFT
event.text: "I'm impressed. I thought those pesky refugees would never leave. Don't worry, we'll pay you for your time." The captain sends you a small amount of resources.

event.name: MILITIA_OUTCAST_REFUGEES_LEFT_DEAD_ESCORT
event.text: The Militia patrol sends a message. "Not that we aren't grateful for stepping in, but that was a little excessive, wasn't it?"

event.name: MILITIA_OUTCAST_REFUGEES_STAY_VIOLENCE
event.text: The leader of the refugees hails you. "Wherever we go, violence seems to follow. Is that the natural state of the world? Still, we are appreciative for you taking our side. We can only hope this doesn't backfire onto us."

event.name: MILITIA_OUTCAST_REFUGEES_STAY
event.text: The leader of the refugees hails you. "We thank you for sticking up for us. Maybe now we can actually live our lives in peace. We will provide you what we can for helping us."

event.name: UNION_DRUNK
event.text: A Union ship accosts you. "Hey! You... jerk!" The owner of the ship seems to be intoxicated. "This whooooole war thing. This is your fault! Yoooouuu... Renegade. None of this rebellion woulda happened if it wasn't for... you know... the Federation being dumb and slow. Now my business is slumping because yooooou and your multiversal war are getting in the way!"

choice.text: (Nights) "Your businesssss isss failing becausssse you SSSSUCK."

event.text:
The drunk tries to respond, but before he can, Nights cuts him off. "Oh, you're jusssst failing becausssse the timessss are bad, it'ssss not your fault? Let me guessss, before the Rebelssss it wassss your wife. Or maybe your competitor did ssssomething unfair? Sssshut up, you're jusssst a failure. Own it."
"But I... but you..." The man tries desperately to counter Nights, but he falters. The sound of stumbling footsteps can be heard as one of the other men on the ship tends to the comms. "Well, I think you did us all a favor for that. Why don't we just give you this and we'll both be on our way?"

choice.text: Engage him with a well reasoned debate.

event.text: You explain to him the importance of your mission, but he completely dismisses all of your well-formulated arguments with the standard variety of fallacies. You politely attempt to inform him of his fallacious reasoning, but for some strange and unknowable reason, this doesn't get through to the angry drunk man. You realise this is leading nowhere and leave the ship and its rants behind.
You engage in a tiring shouting match with the guy. Eventually, something that you say strikes a nerve. He attacks!

choice.text: Threaten to blow his ship to pieces.
Actually blow his ship to pieces.

event.text: "AND THERE IT IS! Look everyone, I'm being repressed!" The Union ship returns fire!
The ship continues to broadcast nasty words at you, but you pay it no mind.
"Whoa whoa, calm down man! I didn't mean nothing by it, we're all friends here! See, friends!" The Union ship tosses a weapon out of the hold and keeps its distance from you.
"Oh you wanna go? You wanna go? I can take you!" The Union ship preempts you by attacking first!
"Well uh... you know uh... I would totally kick your ass, but I have too much work to do. So there." The ship quickly disengages.

event.name: UNION_MINING
event.text: It appears a civilian mining operation is being held in an asteroid field nearby. There are perimeter markers surrounding the field informing unsanctioned personnel that they shouldn't enter the region.
Most of the ships have docked with a nearby outpost out of reach of the asteroid field, but one ship is still in the process of mining some asteroids.
You move in to attack the mining ship.

choice.text: (Mining Beam) Mine some of the asteroids on the outskirts.

event.text: You use your beam to gather a decent supply of scrap and fuel from the asteroid field.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Mine some of the asteroids on the outskirts. [-1|]

event.text: You use your drone to gather a decent supply of scrap and fuel from the asteroid field.

choice.text: (Scrap Arm) Mine some of the asteroids on the outskirts.

event.text: You use your drone to gather a decent supply of scrap and fuel from the asteroid field.

choice.text: (Mining Drone) Mine some of the asteroids on the outskirts. [-1|]

event.text: You use your drone to gather a decent supply of scrap and fuel from the asteroid field.
You have no interest in the mining operation.

event.name: UNION_MINING_CONFRONT
event.text: Before you can leave, the harvester from earlier notices you. "Hey! What do you think you're doing? This is a restricted area, we can't just have random ships barging in here like they own the place!" You can tell that your ship being significantly larger than theirs is the only reason they're not attacking outright.
You're not going to let anybody tell you what to do, regardless of the legality behind it. The Union ship doesn't hesitate to defend themselves.
You turn off the comms and prepare to jump. Even if nobody actually died here, you doubt your actions would do much to improve the reputation that Renegades have garnered in the Union.
You transfer some scrap you collected over to their ship. They barely hesitate before accepting it and clearing you to leave the field.

event.name: UNION_MINING_DESTROY
event.text: It appears the mining ship was carrying large fuel stores. One of your shots must have ignited the cargo bay, because the mining ship explodes. Luckily your ship isn't harmed, but none of their cargo survived. You quickly scrap what's left before reinforcements arrive.

event.name: UNION_MINING_KILL
event.text: With the mining ship crew dead, you find large stores of fuel onboard.

event.name: UNION_FACTORY
event.text: A small partially automated weapon factory lies in the distance. It's protected by a single Militia ship.

choice.text: Hail the factory and ask if they need anything.

event.text: One of the staff of the factory responds. "You wanna help? We have a delivery to make, but our courier is behind schedule. We have some replacement parts that need to be delivered to an anti-ship battery on a nearby world. Are you up for it?"
"Get to it when you can. They'll pay for your delivery fee."

choice.text: Apologize, the destination is too far out of the way.

event.text: You apologize and end the call.

choice.text: Hail the factory and ask if they need anything.

event.text: They don't respond to your hails.

choice.text: Attack the guard to get to the factory.

event.text: You prepare to attack the Militia ship.
You abandon interest in the factory.

choice.text: Attack the guard to get to the factory.

event.text: You prepare to attack the Militia ship.
You have no interest in the factory.

event.name: UNION_FACTORY_CHOICE
event.text: Without the guard to protect them, the few civilian workers scatter. You have the factory all to yourself, but it won't be long until reinforcements arrive. What will you grab?

event.name: UNION_FACTORY_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You have a delivery of ASB parts to drop off at this location.

event.text: You arrive at the planet that requested the parts you currently carry. They are surprised to see that their courier is a Renegade, but they are pleased to have received the delivery. They offer a modest payment.
As you deliver the parts, a Rebel ship enters the system. "So, the Renegade scum is running errands for their masters? Hah, you do more good like this than you ever did fighting our glorious cause."
As you face the enemy ship, the planetary defenses turn on you. It looks like despite your delivery, they'd rather side with the Rebels. Your reputation precedes you, apparently.
The Union planet offers you ASB assistance out of gratitude for your delivery.
They don't seem willing to help. Your reputation could be better, after all.
Rather than help you out, they turn their weapons on you. It looks like despite your delivery, they'd rather side with the Rebels. You must have really ruined your own reputation, somehow.

event.name: UNION_CARAVAN
event.text: It's extremely rare to see a Suzerain ship outside of the Mantis Hive, but even more so in Union territory. One particularly brave Suzerain ship is attacking a Militia caravan. The escort is poorly equipped and hardly stands a chance.
You prepare to attack the Suzerain ship.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Cloak and rob the Transport while they're distracted.

event.text: The Militiamen hardly even realized what happened before you've made away with some supplies. They're too busy with the Mantis to stop you, so you get away scot-free.

choice.text: (Hive Elite) Demand the Suzerain ship stand down.

event.text: Your Mantis berates the Suzerain captain for leaving their territory unprotected to do silly things like "robbing meatsacks". Despite the irony of this, the Suzerain aboard the enemy ship seems ashamed and jumps away. The Militia ships offer a reward, but one of their guards offers his services to you, afraid the Suzerains might return and attack the caravan after you leave.

choice.text: (Flares) Use the flares to lure the Suzerain away from the caravan.

event.text: The Suzerain almost immediately spots the flares and diverts, assuming it's a distress call sent to another nearby vessel. While they're distracted, you escort the Militia ships away. Seems they took quite the hit from the attack, and along with their reward one of the Militia guards offers his services to you, not wanting to risk facing the Suzerains again on the remainder of the trip.
It's a hard choice, but messing with a Suzerain is not something you look forward to doing.

event.name: UNION_CARAVAN_GIFT
event.text: The escort ship took a lot more damage than you first realized. Their life support failed during the fight and their crew asphyxiated. Luckily, the transport is still alive, and they give you some of their cargo as thanks.

event.name: UNION_SMUGGLER_PAYMENT
event.text: You find a Union ship talking with an Argeonn ship. You get the feeling that even if they're not fighting each other, they're not on the friendliest of terms either.

"Look, I'm sorry. I thought I'd have the scrap to pay for those, but after a nasty run-in with Tiiikaka, I was forced to cash out for some repairs. Surely you can understand that, given what your job entails?"
"My sympathies are irrelevant to my profession. Argeonn terms stipulate that payments are always made either in advance or on the spot... and deliveries are not handed over until the payment is made. Unfortunately, you'll just have to do... without those items. Unless your friend here can assist you?"

choice.text: Offer to help pay for the delivery.

event.text: You pool some of your scrap together with the small amount the Union ship still has. It's not cheap, but you're able to pay the full cost up front. The smugglers hand over the delivery before jumping away.

The captain of the Union ship hails you. "Thanks for helping me out there! I had to use those guys to retrieve some of my personal belongings from deep inside Rebel territory. Unfortunately, I can't really pay you conventionally in return for your help, but I should be able to give you a spare weapon of ours."

choice.text: Threaten them to hand over the delivery.

event.text: "...An unwise decision. Then again, expecting a different result would have been... foolish, given that you are likely unaware of the... fragile nature of this cargo." They power up their weapons and face you. Judging by their comments, if you want to get whatever it is that the other Union ship is interested in, you'll have to avoid blowing up their ship.

choice.text: [Reputation: 2+] Convince them to hand over the delivery.

event.text: "Given your extended business history with us, surely you would know that we do not... easily deviate from our standard practices. But at the same time, losing a potential customer would be... unfortunate. If you are willing to vouch for them, then I think we can make an... exception this time." They turn to face the Union ship. "However, do not expect any leniency when we... arrive for payments." The Union captain gladly agrees, and receives their delivery from the smugglers. The Argeonn ship jumps away after making the transfer.

The captain of the Union ship hails you. "Thanks for helping me out there! I had to use those guys to retrieve some of my personal belongings from deep inside Rebel territory. Unfortunately, I can't really pay you conventionally in return for your help, but I should be able to give you a spare weapon of ours."
Even from a distance, you can still feel a fraction of the tension between the two ships. Eventually they jump away in opposite directions.

event.name: UNION_SMUGGLER_PAYMENT_WIN
event.text: You hand over the delivery from the smuggler ship to the Union ship. Their captain speaks with you during the transfer. "Thanks for helping me out there! I had to use those guys to retrieve some of my personal belongings from deep inside Rebel territory. Unfortunately, I can't really pay you conventionally in return for your help, but I should be able to give you a spare weapon of ours."

event.name: DISTRESS_UNION_CLINIC_HARMONY
event.text: There is a Union clinic under attack by a Harmony vessel at this beacon. Noticing your approach, the Engi ship sends a message. "This = Harmony affair. Do not interfere."
"This facility = commonly utilized by Separatists and Rebel sympathizers. Unacceptable levels of tolerance towards deviance detected. Correcting the error. Repeat: Do not interfere."

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew) "You are in violation of Federation Statutes 105.2, 105.5 and 105.9!"

event.text: Your Zoltan angrily quotes the Federation regulations that prohibit attacks on medical personnel, and treaties codifying neutrality in treating the wounded regardless of ideology. The Engi struggles to make a compelling counter-argument, and eventually gives up.

"The Harmony is [acting] as -discordantly- as usual. Unaligned clinic = common good. Harmony vessel = Tyranny. Do something -useful- for [once]: and never return."
"Priority target: detected. Separatist = must be dealt with." True to their word, the Harmony ship charges its weapons and changes targets.

"The Harmony is -willing- to go too far for its ends. You cannot control -everyone-, nor should you try. On behalf of your human -allies-, you must halt your aggression and pay restitution."
"TRZ-1L detected. The Harmony demands: your unconditional surrender. Defiance of the Harmony's directives = unacceptable." The Harmony ship immediately engages your ship!

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Have your Engi find a compromise.

event.text: Your crewmember seems hesitant, but relents. Through your Engi, you're eventually able to convince the Harmony to let the residents go free.
The staff of the clinic don't seem happy with your compromise. Still, they find it within themselves to give you a small reward for their freedom.

choice.text: (Defender Crew) Convince your Defender to talk them out of it.

event.text: Your Defender seems hesitant, but relents. The Defender convinces the Engi vessel that this action endangers the good standing between the Harmony and the Federation, and that there are better ways to enact the Harmony's will.

choice.text: (Positive Harmony Reputation) Use your good standing with the Harmony to convince them to stand down.

event.text: You tell the Engi that you wouldn't be making a big deal out of this if it didn't matter. The Engi put up a little bit more resistance until you finally manage to get through to them. "Renegade: has good standing. Will defer decision for the time being."

choice.text: Try to talk them out of it.

event.text: "Federation ship = warned. Punitive action ensues." The Engi ship breaks off its attack on the clinic to face your ship instead.
The Harmony is an ally to the Federation; you decide to trust that they are acting in good faith.
"Error. Non-compliant Federation ship detected." The Engi ship breaks off its attack on the clinic to face your ship instead.
The Harmony is an ally to the Federation, you decide to trust that they are acting in good faith.

textList.name: UNION_CLINIC_SAVED
textList.text: "Thank you for protecting us. We make it a point not to turn down help from those who ask for it. That's the way medicine should be done." One of the medics offers to join.
"Is it just me, or has the Harmony recently been more... scary? If you wouldn't mind, I'd like to show my gratitude by working alongside you."
"From all of us in the clinic's staff, and on behalf of all who visit us, thank you very much. Please, take me with you, and I will help in any way I can."

event.name: DISTRESS_UNION_LANIUS_MISTAKE
event.text: An errant Lanius ship is attached to a Union station. Both the ship and the station are sending out a distress call. The station's distress call reads "Mayday! We're being eaten by a Lanius! Please save us!" The Lanius, however, only produces a garbled screeching.

choice.text: (Damaging Beam) Cut the ship off the station.

event.text: With a swift strike, the beam manages to separate the ships. The Lanius detaches and gives the station a wide berth without warping away.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Cut the ship off the station.

event.text: The drone precisely separates the ship from the station. The Lanius detaches and gives the station a wide berth without warping away.

choice.text: (Lanius Crew) "Lanius ship stuck. Doesn't mean harm. Wants to trade for scrap. Has goods. Broken translator."

event.text: The station's comm officer seems relieved. "So we're not under attack? Well, let's get out there and fix it then." In short order, the station and Lanius are separated, and begin to trade, with your Lanius serving as the intermediary. The station pays graciously for your help.
"Thanks. Have treasure. Very grateful."
The vessel continues to screech, but it defends itself. However, for some reason, it doesn't detach, therefore having no maneuverability.

choice.text: Try to communicate with the Lanius.

event.text: Both the ship and station continue to hail, but you pay them no mind.

event.name: UNION_LANIUS_SOLVED_NO_TRANSLATOR
event.text: The commander of the station hails your ship out of gratitude. "We were definitely screwed without your help. Please, take this token of our appreciation. Although... the ship isn't attacking or leaving. It's just broadcasting a message on repeat. What do you think it's trying to say?"
The ship tries in vain to get a response. Eventually, it jumps away. "Well, I guess we don't have to worry anymore."

The ship sends out a message that sounds like a windchime. It leaves behind a gift and scoops up the scrap that you have given it. "So it wanted to trade... I guess we weren't in danger after all. Well, I'm glad this got sorted."

choice.text: Pick up the gift the Lanius left behind.

event.text: The ship sends out a message that sounds like a windchime. It leaves behind a gift and scoops up the missiles that you have given it. "So it wanted to trade... I guess we weren't in danger after all. Well, I'm glad this got sorted."

choice.text: Pick up the gift the Lanius left behind.

event.text: The ship sends out a message that sounds like a windchime. It leaves behind a gift and scoops up the drones that you have given it. "So it wanted to trade... I guess we weren't in danger after all. Well, I'm glad this got sorted."

choice.text: Pick up the gift the Lanius left behind.

event.text: You send the Lanius a very clear message trying to discern their situation. By sheer luck, you manage to find a pattern in their screeches. The communication you form is very rudimentary - you send an image, they send dings or screeches to determine whether you're hot or cold. Essentially, they seem to be stuck, and they only want to trade, because they are hungry.
You hail the station. The station's comm officer seems relieved. "You think so? Well, let's get out there and fix it then." In short order, the station and Lanius are separated.

You send the Lanius message after message trying to evoke a meaningful response. The response you get back range from screeches to dings. As much as you try, neither of you are able to get through to each other, although the Lanius doesn't seem to make any aggressive moves.

choice.text: Tell the station you can't determine the problem.

event.text: "So that's it then? We're just stuck like this...? I guess we'll just have to figure it out on our own..."
You hail the Lanius. You try to probe them for what's going on. However, after several messages of no success, something you say suddenly makes them shift their behavior - they become aggressive!

event.name: QUEST_UNION_HOTHEADED_CIV
event.text: A nearby civilian settlement hails you. "Renegade, come in! I know you're probably busy, but a friend of mine is in danger and I don't know where else to turn. One of those Slug hackers scammed him and took control of his account, so he borrowed a shuttle and went off to give them a piece of his mind. The poor guy's gullible and naive, but he's also a huge hothead. Do you think you have time to save him?"
"Thank you. I'll send you the transponder for his ship. As far as payment, I wish I could give you more, but this is all I have."

choice.text: We don't have time for this.

event.text: "I thought that might be the case..." The civilian hangs up, disappointed.

event.name: QUEST_UNION_HOTHEADED_CIV_SPOT

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to look for a reckless civilian in pursuit of hackers.

event.text: Following the transponder, you detect a well-hidden Slug ship preying upon a civilian shuttle.

choice.text: (Upg. Hacking) Hack their mainframe before they notice you.

event.text: You manage to hack into their ship's computer and revert all the permission changes to the accounts they've preyed upon. "What the... Our profitssss! You'll regret thissss!"
"Oh... sssshoot! The Federation found ussss!" They quickly change targets to attack you.

event.name: UNION_HOTHEAD_GRATITUDE
event.text: "Let me check... yes! I can access my accounts again. You're a life-saver, Renegade. Let me see what I can spare..." The civilian sends you some scrap as a reward.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_STATION_UNION
event.text: This Union station is no friend of yours. Now inhabited by pirates, it's aiming its entire arsenal straight at you!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_COALITION_UNION
event.text: A Coalition ship is slinking around the area, no doubt hunting for Unionists to pick off. Spotting you instead, it decides you'll be a nice challenge for it and attacks.

event.name: RST_START
event.text: A small orange vessel probing the nearby beacon stops when it notices you and sends a distress call. Out of curiosity, you pick it up. "Foreign vessel, this is Surveyor 192 from the R.S.T. corporation. On behalf of the company I formally request any information you may have regarding the whereabouts of Dr. Renfield."

"Unfortunate, unfortunate... however, you do appear to be a military vessel, yes? Or at least a very well armed civilian. We have the general coordinates of where we believe Dr. Renfield to be. We hope to locate him, but we suspect he may be in danger. Our vessel is too poorly equipped to handle it alone. Could you take a look for us? R.S.T. will reward you handsomely if you succeed."
"Alright! Transfering coordinates as we speak. Good luck captain! Oh, and thanks for the help."

choice.text: Remind me who Dr. Renfield is?

event.text: "Oh, my apologies! I assumed everyone here knew... Dr. Renfield is a brillaint physicist, perhaps the greatest of our time! Among his most crowning achievements was the invention of the aptly named Renfield Bombs! Their explosive potential is greater than any previously known nuclear device of any species! They were used to eradicate the Vek on Earth, but the resulting explosion caused massive flooding. The incident did not... reflect wonderfully on the R.S.T. corporation, but that doesn't matter right now."
"Alright! Transfering coordinates as we speak. Good luck captain! Oh, and thanks for the help."
"Understandable. We will not waste your time any further! R.S.T. out."
"Understandable. We will not waste your time any further! R.S.T. out."

choice.text: Oh yeah I know all about Renfield. I think he was my brother or something?

event.text: "Brother? What? Renfield doesn't have any siblings! Ugh, it's like no one takes anything seriously anymore." The ship hangs up.

event.name: SPIDER_QUEST_START
event.text: You find a number of ships fleeing from a small space station. A squadron of Militia vessels have been deployed around the area. One ship hails you: "Civilian, this system is restricted. We must request that you leave immediately."

choice.text: We're no civilian ship, what is the issue?

event.text: "A Federation military vessel? My bad then. This station has been infected by some kind of weird... giant alien spiders. Think you could clear this station of the infestation, without causing too much damage?"

The Militiamen give you clearance to engage the station, but give two last warnings. "We aren't sure what these things are, but they seem to be able to keep the station's systems functional. If you have to cause some damage that's understandable, but please do not cause very much, we can't go around destroying civilian property."

"Oh, Commander Haynes! Pardon me sir, I didn't realize you were aboard! Yes sir, spiders! Of the giant alien variety!" The Militiaman stands up straight and salutes awkwardly, almost falling backwards in the process. Haynes goes a bit green in the face. "Great... spiders... when you say giant, how big exactly do you mean?" The Militiaman contemplates for a moment before responding, "Hmmm... about the size of a man? The babies are like the size of dogs. Very big. Hence the descriptor, sir! Uhm... sir?" You notice Haynes has left the room, and upon checking the cameras find he's throwing up in the restroom. He should get over it soon.

The Militiamen give you clearance to engage the station, but give two last warnings. "We aren't sure what these things are, but they seem to be able to keep the station's systems functional. If you have to cause some damage that's understandable, but please do not cause very much, we can't go around destroying civilian property." You have some of the other crew pull Haynes out of the restroom and prepare for combat.

choice.text: Perhaps this isn't the best idea.

event.text: You apologize but inform the Militiamen you can't help. Before you leave you make a point to tell Haynes you turned down the request, and a wave of relief floods his face before he returns to losing his lunch.

choice.text: We're no civilian ship, what is the issue?

event.text: "Well, I'll be! You're the ship who was sent out to take care of that spider issue. Unfortunately, there's still some spider problems on the outskirts here. Don't suppose you could take care of these ones again, could you?"
The Militiamen give you clearance to engage the station. "Just as before, please try and be careful! We can't go around blowing up civilian property!"
You navigate away from the station, but you stay in the system long enough to do something on the ship.

event.name: INFESTED_STATION_WIN
event.text: You've cleared out the spider infestation from the station. The Militiamen thank you for your help, and payment is given for your effort.

"Not sure there's much I can tell you. Things came from the Brood, one of those pirate clans that live out in abandoned space. Commander Montgomery could tell you more than me, but he's busy handling the infestation elsewhere. Seems the spiders have finally got so out of hand that even the Brood can't control them anymore, and now's our chance."

"We hired another Renegade sorta like you a while back to help but from what I understand he hasn't been of much use. I'd be hesitant sending in another loose cannon, but considering you handled the situation so delicately here why the hell not. I'll transfer the coordinates for the Brood stronghold to you. Best of luck."

choice.text: Accept the reward and carry on.

event.name: INFESTED_STATION_WIN_REPEAT
event.text: "Thanks again for the help! Hopefully we'll be able to clear these things entirely out of civilian space in a while from now."

event.name: INFESTED_STATION_SURRENDER
event.text: "You've caused too much damage to the station's hull! You need to stop damaging it! Kill the spiders or quit and we'll get someone better for the job. We'll pay you for at least trying to help if you do."
You can tell you're only being paid so the Militiamen can be assured you'll leave, but it's better than nothing.

choice.text: No no, we can do this!

event.text: The captain of the other ship sighs. "Fine, but make sure not to destroy it."

event.name: INFESTED_STATION_DESTROY
event.text: "God damn it, we told you not to destroy the station!" Highly displeased with you, the Militiamen demand you leave the system.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK
event.text: As is customary in Union space, several corporate advertisements from the planet nearby play over your radio. You listen to them idly as you browse the nearby shipyards, gazing at various antique vessels. One in particular catches your eye, a Kestrel in seemingly full working order! You don't get to look at it very long though, when one of the advertisements catches your ear. It seems one from "Dewey Alms", CEO of Archive Incorporated, has an outgoing request for any capable mercenary vessel.
Your mission here is for the Federation, you can't be getting sidetracked with other mercenary work.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_OFFER
event.text: It seems these shipyards are in fact owned by Archive, so it's not difficult to get in touch with a correspondant who patches you in to Dewey directly. "Renegades? I have experience with your types. Before we begin, I would like to make it clear that, while I might be the CEO of Archive Inc., in this request I am not speaking on behalf of the company in any way. It would be... bad PR to get involved with more inter-dimensional Renegades after the disaster of the 'Rusting Hulks' incident. I'm sure you understand."

"Good, good. Heh, don't worry. We aren't skirting the Union's laws or anything with this. I just don't want any backlash from a personal affair. As you may or may not already know, Archive specializes in the... well, archival of Antiquum Terrae (or as you might know it, Old Earth) technology and culture. This matter concerns one of my most prized antiques, a 23rd century 'Kasparov', the first FTL-capable ship produced by humankind. Originally made to transport passengers to and from Tau Ceti. A remarkable achievement... but she has been stolen by pirates! I can't gather why... sure, she marks a new age in exploration and discovery, but why would a pirate want such an outdated piece of technology?"

"But to who? Plenty of Kasparov crafts were made. This particular model would be of no interest to anyone but an avid historian or ship enthusiast like me. Never the matter. My request; hunt down those thieves and secure the Kasparov. I haven't in mind any particular reward, but I'm sure we can work something out. Name your price."

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_OFFER_KESTREL
event.text: "Huh? That old thing? Oh, I can most certainly part ways with it. I jumped on purchasing one when they saw a sudden resurgence in popularity at the end of the Civil War, but now it seems everyone has one. Good deal then. One last thing - I've programmed the coordinates for the pirate ship into my assistant, Gana. He's just a machine, and not a very personable one at that, but he'll be sufficiently useful in combat. Best of luck captain. Godspeed!"

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_DECLINE
event.text: "You won't help then? What a loss... I'll have to find someone else then. Good day, captain."

choice.text: Do you happen to know someone named Zenith?

event.text: "Zenith? As in the Pinnacle CEO?" You nod your head. "Well, yes, I know the name. One of the four corporations that used to dominate Earth. Never talked very extensively with her - she was obsessed with the nebulous future, while I care more about the concrete past. Never the matter, why do you ask?" You shrug and mention your brief run-in. "Ah. What a coincidence. For such an infinitely large Multiverse, it sometimes feels so small..."

"Now then, that aside, back to that Kasparov issue - I can't fathom why anyone would steal it. Plenty of Kasparov crafts were made. This particular model would be of no interest to anyone but an avid historian or ship enthusiast like me. Never the matter. My request; hunt down those thieves and secure the Kasparov. I haven't in mind any particular reward, but I'm sure we can work something out. Name your price."

choice.text: [Federation Database] What was the 'Rusting Hulks' incident?

surrender.text: "Christ! Stop, stop! You've caused enough damage! You one'a Wright's cronies? What the hell do you want?"

event.text: "That stupid ring ship? You were sent by Archive, weren't you! We don't have it anymore, alright? We were contracted to steal it for another collector!"

destroyed.text: The Brood ship has been destroyed... which means you won't be able to track down the 'Kasparov'. You've failed the mission, so it's best not to return to Dewey.

deadCrew.text: The Brood pirates have been killed... which means you won't be able to track down the 'Kasparov'. You've failed the mission, so it's best not to return to Dewey.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_PIRATE

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've tracked down the pirate ship at Gana's coordinates. Seems it's a Brood ship - you've heard about these, but you suspect Dewey intentionally left that little detail out of the job offer.
Remember - you need these guys to surrender to find the location of the 'Kasparov', so try not to kill them!

choice.text: We aren't picking a fight with the Brood.

event.text: You're sure there was something significant about this encounter, but it's too late now.

choice.text: [Federation Database] Read more on the Brood.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_QUEST_2
event.text: "I'm not saying! Oh, wait. You can literally kill me right now. Alright, fair game. We were hired by Hideo Tanaka, CEO of Hephaestus. I'm sure you've heard of him. He heard Archive had this big fancy ship called the 'Molotov' or... whatever. He didn't want anyone else to know he was stealing it though, so he hired us to do it. I've told you everything, now let us go!"

choice.text: One last thing - where is the ship now?

event.text: "Weren't you listening? It's at the nearby Hephaestus Shipyards. They're probably gonna break it down for transport or whatever." You manage to convince the pirates to hand you the coordinates, and watch as they jump away moments later. What a bunch of cowards.

destroyed.text: It seems the Hephaestus staff weren't kidding - they'd rather fight to the death than face the wrath of their boss.

deadCrew.text: It seems the Hephaestus staff weren't kidding - they'd rather fight to the death than face the wrath of their boss.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_RINGSHIP

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You were suspicious of a trick at first, but this is most certainly the right location. In the distance you can see what is definitely the Kasparov, and a small Hephaestus depot by which the 'Kasparov' is being inspected. You catch some radio chatter between ships. "Yeah, boss says we gotta bring this 'Shakarov' thing to Mr. Tanaka's collection. God knows breaking this thing down is gonna suck, but if we screw up he's probably gonna sell us to Tiiikaka. Make sure there isn't a scratch on this or we're toast!"

choice.text: Demand they give back the Kasparov.

event.text: "What? Who the hell are you? Why are you here? Whadd'ya want with the 'Ivanov'?"

"Yeah yeah, Makogonov, shmakogonov. Oh, you're one of them MV people. With the fancy blue chemtrails or whatever. Archive sent you, didn't they? Look buddy, I don't care one bit about Alms's beef with Mr. Tanaka. But Tanaka is the one who pays the man who pays the man who pays the man who pays the man who pays me. So I ain't giving up this 'Shirov' thing without a fight, you hear?"

choice.text: Well, if it's a fight you want...

event.text: "Crap, we actually doing this? I shoulda known not to mention combat in front of a mercenary!"
You've come quite far - but this isn't worth it. You can't go picking fights with giga-corporations.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_QUEST_3
event.text: It seems most of the other ships were just automated construction drones. The depot's skeleton crew surrender, allowing you to secure the Kasparov and contact Dewey.

"Incredible! I shall see to it that your efforts do not go unpaid! I shall forward those Kestrel blueprints to you immediately. Oh, and if you still have Gana on you, feel free to keep him. He's better suited to a military vessel anyways. Before you go though, who did end up being the culprit?"

choice.text: Hideo Tanaka hired pirates to steal your ship for his collection.

event.text: "That old assbucket. I should have known. Hideo takes whatever he wants from anyone he wants, even a fellow Union megacorp. Oh well. As Grandfather would say... well Grandfather didn't say much. He mostly just talked about satellites. Anyways, I thank you for your services. Best of luck on the rest of your mission."

event.name: COREWORLDS_EARTH

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is Earth, the Homeworld of the Human race.

event.text: You've discovered a planet all too familiar. It's Antiquum Terrae, more often referred to as Old Earth, the homeworld and origin of the Human race! Though most of the planet has flooded, a few large and densely populated cities remain.

On the planet's surface is a museum and large memorial park. The ship computer informs you the subject matter involves the Mantis invasion of Earth. Attendance is free but it'll likely take a lot of time to browse the place.
You land on a large platform and exit the ship. You take a long stroll through the park and come across several plaques detailing things about the war. One in particular stands out to you.

"It all looked bleak for the citizens of Earth until the creation of the very first Pre-Igniter tech, invented by Jackson Newman. This augment was then merged with a powerful laser model developed by Zulfiqar Armaments, a busy corporation that has since grown to be very wealthy and powerful in modern times. Though the weapon was once considered a super-weapon so long ago, it is likely it would still stand the test of time and be very efficient in modern combat."

As you keep reading, you notice a section describing the locations of the parts of the weapon. "After the war was over the weapon was dismantled and many of the parts were repossessed." Maybe if you can track down their locations, you can re-assemble the gun!

choice.text: Read on the location of the barrel.

event.text: "The first part, the barrel, was originally given to a man by the name of Alaster Williams before it was stolen by a Mantis warlord and passed down across many generations. It is a valuable heirloom in their family, and it is highly unlikely they would surrender it to anyone, especially those who defeated them in the war."

choice.text: Read on the location of the base.

event.text: "The second part, the base, was buried alongside the creator of the weapon and its tech. The gravesite is among those of every soldier lost to the Mantis invasions."

choice.text: Read on the location of the Pre-Igniter.

event.text: "The final part, the Pre-Igniter was stolen by a Smuggler. It has been circulating the black market for many years, repossessed many times. Though it would serve as a valuable collectors item, the augment itself is told to no longer function as intended due to years of misuse by pirates."
With all of the information you need to collect the parts, you hurry back to the ship.

choice.text: We don't have time for wild goose chases around the sector.

event.text: You don't have time to go learning history. You pull away from the planet.

event.name: QUEST_GATLING_BARREL

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of the Gatling Barrel.

event.text: You have arrived at a busy Mantis warcamp on a small moon. Several ships lay on the surface, the largest being a Suzerain and no doubt where the Gatling barrel is held.

choice.text: Hail them and try to negotiate.

event.text: A Mantis with a long scar running down their face responds. "Yes? What reason has ship called me?"

choice.text: We've come for the Gatling Barrel.

event.text: "What? You mean spinny stick? You not dare take spinny stick! Precious heirloom passed down from grandfather, not plaything of stupid Federation captain!"

choice.text: Then we'll have to take it!

event.text: The Mantis shrieks and ends the call, and the Suzerain ship comes to life. It rises to meet you. If you had to guess, the 'spinny stick' is kept on that ship and you'll have to empty it of crew to get it.
"No! No! No! Not care who are! Shoo! Not welcome here." Despite the Mantis's tantrum, the only option that remains is to take it from him.

The Mantis shrieks and ends the call, and the Suzerain ship comes to life. It rises to meet you. If you had to guess, the 'spinny stick' is kept on that ship and you'll have to empty it of crew to get it.

choice.text: This is risky, we should leave.

event.text: You decide against pulling closer to the camp and stay far away from the moon.

event.name: QUEST_GATLING_BASE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of the Gatling Base.

event.text: The graveyard at this beacon isn't quite what you expected. Rather than a spooky field or dark and stormy swamp planet, it appears to be a nice flat patch of grass decorated with the tombs of the fallen soldiers. You aren't sure if you really want to go grave robbing these people.

choice.text: We have a war of our own to fight. If these people were alive, they'd understand.

event.text: You inspect the gravesite and realise there's nothing to suggest where the Gatling Gun might be buried. You pick out a few graves that sound familiar, but you aren't sure which one. You think the plaque said who it was, but you'll have to remember who.

You start digging, but all you find inside is a rotting corpse. Disgusted and disappointed, you prepare to leave, when an Elite Federation ship swings by and spots you in the act. "Assholes! You'd dare dishonor the heroes buried here?" They raise their weapons and attack!
You start digging to find that you were correct! Inside the grave is the Gatling Base! You have your crew haul it back to the ship.
As you're leaving, a Federation Elite flies past, spotting you in the process! "Assholes! You'd dare dishonor the heroes buried here?" They raise their weapons and attack!

You start digging, but all you find inside is a rotting corpse. Disgusted and disappointed, you prepare to leave, when an Elite Federation ship swings by and spots you in the act. "Assholes! You'd dare dishonor the heroes buried here?" They raise their weapons and attack!

You start digging, but all you find inside is a rotting corpse. Disgusted and disappointed, you prepare to leave, when an Elite Federation ship swings by and spots you in the act. "Assholes! You'd dare dishonor the heroes buried here?" They raise their weapons and attack!

choice.text: We have better things to do than dishonoring the dead.

event.text: You ignore the graveyard and fly away.

event.name: QUEST_GATLING_AUGMENT

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of the Pre-Igniter tech.

event.text: You spot an armoured Smuggler Station orbiting the beacon, soliciting to a few smaller ships. It's surprising they can operate here despite the swarms of Militiamen protecting the beacon, but this is the place you're looking for.

You hail the Smugglers and explain the situation. The captain gives a wheezy chuckle at your explanation. "Is that so now? Well I've been struggling to get rid of this crap for a while now, and at last I found someone willing to pay a price for it! Hell, I'll even offer you a special 'Jumbo Deal' with some extra supplies for only a minor price increase!"

choice.text: Buy the "Jumbo Deal" along with the Pre-Igniter.

event.text: You aren't going to pay these smugglers anything! You raise the weapons and attack. The other few ships shopping scatter as you approach the station.
You ignore the station and fly away.
